Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Package \Pack"age\ (p[a^]k"[asl]j; 48), n. 1. Act or process of packing. [1913 Webster]
2. A bundle made up for transportation; a packet; a bale; a parcel; as, a package of goods. [1913 Webster]
3. A charge made for packing goods. [1913 Webster]
4. A duty formerly charged in the port of London on goods imported or exported by aliens, or by denizens who were the sons of aliens. [1913 Webster]

package n 1: a collection of things wrapped or boxed together [syn: {bundle}, {packet}, {parcel}] 2: a wrapped container [syn: {parcel}] 3: (computer science) written programs or procedures or rules and associated documentation pertaining to the operation of a computer system and that are stored in read/write memory; "the market for software is expected to expand" [syn: {software}, {software system}, {software package}] [ant: {hardware}] v : put into a box; "box the gift, please" [syn: {box}] [ant: {unbox}]
